@EU_Commission @internetthought Wait wait wait. So you're -blocking by default- and expecting creators to jump through hoops with their ISP's (which is unlikely to be a simple process) to get their content verified so they can post it online.

You are banning the memes, and making paperwork for them.

@EU_Commission @internetthought Sorry but since #Article13 WILL ban uploaded content that has copyrighted content. This includes fanart, fan made content, memes, tweets, EVERYTHING! This horrible law not only affects our freedom of expression but also our employment and education. Please delete this awful law.
@EU_Commission @TimmermansEU @VeraJourova @EU_Justice @ChristianWigand Ask the Catalan people! Wake up Europe!

@EU_Commission @internetthought And certainly the story of creativity and copyright, tell (as I sometimes read) another. Because I have not seen anything less creative than copyright. I just need to see what happens in music with the "autotune generation".

@EU_Commission @internetthought So do not come with the story of" the authors' defense", because we are millions who create with free licenses. Maybe what you are referring to is that we do not generate so much money, and it is true. Because we are more interested in culture than money, not like others...
@EU_Commission @internetthought And as an author these intellectual property laws in the image and likeness of the copyright industry violate the rights of authors who use free licenses...
@EU_Commission @internetthought We already saw when we tried to approve that Hitlerian treaty called ACTA, but seriously look for true experts who know how the Internet works.

@EU_Commission @internetthought That's a load of bulshit, because meanwhile it has lost  effectiveness, and on the case other types of content, like news, it will have also loss usefulness for the consumers and therefore will no longuer be in any way monetized by its creators.

@EU_Commission @_Nickelfront Because that is exactly what is in article 13. Along with other types of remixed content. And because existing filters are known to be crap, even original content will be censored. Authors like me are against this incompetent proposal.

@EU_Commission @FedericaMog @JHahnEU @eu_eeas @MajaEUspox Nothing to be proud about!!! Ine winders what they arr selling out our country for???!!! More taxes? More salary/pension cuts? More unemployment? SHAME on them!!!

@EU_Commission @internetthought Sorry to say, but u need a crash course on the basics of EU Copyright. We asked the EC to #fixcopyright precisely because there's no parody/educational/you name it "exception in place" in all the EU. U mean the filter knows what is a parody and where should block and where not?

@EU_Commission I recommend visiting  Old Sarum close to Salisbury and near Stonehenge. OS was the most important city in Britain before London was even thought of. As John Constable wrote of OS "here is no continuing city". A reminder of the impermanence of man's creations.

@EU_Commission @GattAllan I seriously would like the #EU_Commission to explain how it is not a ban of memes when it is required to take all uploaded copyrighted content down by social media platforms... and then have lengthy legal proceedings to determine whether an upload could be a parody...

@EU_Commission @internetthought This answer summarizes lots of whats wrong with art13
-"Ask to re-publish" > means it was indeed filtered & blocked. 
And what a burdensome process!!
-you are explicitly confirming that privately owned platforms will be in charge of guaranteeing free speech exceptions. Great.

@EU_Commission @internetthought Prosecuting violations on a per-case basis costs less than setting up all this circus with cautionary machines, cautionary removals, angry protests and embarrassing re-publishing (perhaps). What kind of maths exactly did you use in the process?
@EU_Commission VAT istelf is a fraud upon working population that means we must combat VAT first.

@EU_Commission @EBienkowskaEU @Moedas @EU_Growth @EU_H2020 @LuciaCaudet You are currently killing the entrepreneurial spirit with among other things #Article13 - I am working in a start-up and we are actively considering relocating to the US due to the bureaucracy currently being implemented including threats to the start-up community through Art13.

@EU_Commission @internetthought You do understand how massively bureaucratic it would be to go through a re-publish request for every "parodic" upload made which gets automatically censored (as a result of an alleged copyright violation)?
@EU_Commission @internetthought I'm sorry @EU_Commission , I'm afraid I cannot allow you to say that. Harmonised copyright exceptions ===============> not found

@EU_Commission @internetthought Have you any idea how much unnecessary and unworkable bureaucracy you are creating by this? #memes aren't the half of it. #parody isn't the half of it. #uploadfilters don't work now and will never work fairly and evenly. They'll just create a barrier to #FreedomOfSpeech,
@EU_Commission @mrjamesob Oh dear! another commonwealth failure - The disgraced Dr. Fox must be getting ready to jump off his Atlantic Bridge. 😈

@EU_Commission Those Russian trolls and their idiotic minions will love this.

Remember, don't tell people what they have in common. Show them how different they are.....just like Vlad would want you to do.

@EU_Commission @internetthought A "complaint and redress mechanism" that sends all user complaints straight to a black hole would be enough to comply with Article 13(2). The directive proposal says nothing about upholding user rights and copyright exceptions without going all the way to a court.
@EU_Commission @EBienkowskaEU @Moedas @EU_Growth @EU_H2020 @LuciaCaudet Surely this calls for more EU regulation.
@EU_Commission the link seems to be broken… 😟

@EU_Commission @EBienkowskaEU @Moedas @EU_Growth @EU_H2020 @LuciaCaudet And a top "innovation leader" is leaving the European Union next March – which is not a good look. With the UK's new immigration policy closing the door to unskilled EU labour and opening it to the world's most talented people, it looks set to further outpace you...
@EU_Commission @internetthought You know these kind of unilateral decisions are the reason ppl want to leave the union,right?
@EU_Commission @noevanhulst @EBienkowskaEU @Moedas @EU_Growth @EU_H2020 @LuciaCaudet Wij hebben innovation leaders 🤣🤣🤣🤣🤣🤣🤣 @kordwarshuis @nmaccentaigu @lemni

@EU_Commission @internetthought It's disingenuous to respond with such a legalistic reading of the charge. The proposal erects large barriers for users to exercise their right to free expression, their work being subjected to automated filtering and bureaucratic recourse mechanisms before it is even published.

@EU_Commission @internetthought What happens if they don't re-publish? Also, when platforms today remove content they put a message justifying it was copyright infringement or other law infringement. They can kill the reputation of an user! There's no way you can fully get it back!

@EU_Commission @internetthought It will be blocked first anyway. What about critiques? They usually contail copyrighted content that can be used to block unwanted and bad reviews. What about streaming platforms like twitchtv, they would require to license everything that might be shown. Same with Lets plays

@EU_Commission @EBienkowskaEU @Moedas @EU_Growth @EU_H2020 @LuciaCaudet This is Spain, we have innovated in justice. Politicians who put up urns and leave and decorate police for torturing and hitting our people are imprisoned. Greetings ... And get going

@EU_Commission @internetthought This is wrong. There is no harmonized parody exception in the EU. Also, memes would not be covered by the quoting exception in many EU countries because it doesn't constitute criticism of the work. Please don't spread false and incorrect information.
